chat.title: comment
chat.message: (1) I think we need to clarify if this is for patients admitted in active labour... or consider either a module or new orderset should be made for "when in active labour", othwerwise there are multiple orders here that could be given erroneosly to patients admitted in latent labour or in antepartum period (2) nitrous oxide only for use in active labour. (3) morphine and fentanyl should not be given for 5 days. (4) presumably oxytocin orders are for administration at delivery when anterior shoulder delivered. (5) Need to clarify at what point during labour fentanly is appropriate to use and morphine is appropriate to use otherwise will end up having to narcan a bunch of babies.
